result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert Ritthaler was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Robert Ritthaler was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Robert Ritthaler was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.   AMENDED 06-15-2017:  CFTS (amended to reflect conditional time credit given on Ct. 4)

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time employment.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obgliations.  Comply with all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  No contact with any victims.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Donald Conner
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim AA & RW & AM & MS (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive at all.   Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.   Make all court appearances on time.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Robert Ritthaler in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Robert Ritthaler in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
